speaker: Hostess
text_entry: SCENE IV. France. The KING'S palace.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Flourish. Enter the FRENCH KING, the DAUPHIN, the DUKES of BERRI and BRETAGNE, the Constable, and others

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Thus comes the English with full power upon us;

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: And more than carefully it us concerns

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: To answer royally in our defences.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Therefore the Dukes of Berri and of Bretagne,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Of Brabant and of Orleans, shall make forth,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: And you, Prince Dauphin, with all swift dispatch,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: To line and new repair our towns of war

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: With men of courage and with means defendant;

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: For England his approaches makes as fierce

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: As waters to the sucking of a gulf.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: It fits us then to be as provident

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: As fear may teach us out of late examples

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Left by the fatal and neglected English

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Upon our fields.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: My most redoubted father,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: It is most meet we arm us 'gainst the foe;

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: For peace itself should not so dull a kingdom,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Though war nor no known quarrel were in question,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: But that defences, musters, preparations,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Should be maintain'd, assembled and collected,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: As were a war in expectation.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Therefore, I say 'tis meet we all go forth

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: To view the sick and feeble parts of France:

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: And let us do it with no show of fear;

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: No, with no more than if we heard that England

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Were busied with a Whitsun morris-dance:

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: For, my good liege, she is so idly king'd,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Her sceptre so fantastically borne

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: By a vain, giddy, shallow, humorous youth,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: That fear attends her not.

speaker: Constable
text_entry: O peace, Prince Dauphin!

speaker: Constable
text_entry: You are too much mistaken in this king:

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Question your grace the late ambassadors,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: With what great state he heard their embassy,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: How well supplied with noble counsellors,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: How modest in exception, and withal

speaker: Constable
text_entry: How terrible in constant resolution,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: And you shall find his vanities forespent

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Were but the outside of the Roman Brutus,

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Covering discretion with a coat of folly;

speaker: Constable
text_entry: As gardeners do with ordure hide those roots

speaker: Constable
text_entry: That shall first spring and be most delicate.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Well, 'tis not so, my lord high constable;

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: But though we think it so, it is no matter:

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: In cases of defence 'tis best to weigh

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: The enemy more mighty than he seems:

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: So the proportions of defence are fill'd;

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Which of a weak or niggardly projection

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Doth, like a miser, spoil his coat with scanting

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: A little cloth.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Think we King Harry strong;

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: And, princes, look you strongly arm to meet him.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: The kindred of him hath been flesh'd upon us;

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: And he is bred out of that bloody strain

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: That haunted us in our familiar paths:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Witness our too much memorable shame

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: When Cressy battle fatally was struck,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: And all our princes captiv'd by the hand

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Of that black name, Edward, Black Prince of Wales;

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Whiles that his mountain sire, on mountain standing,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Up in the air, crown'd with the golden sun,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Saw his heroical seed, and smiled to see him,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Mangle the work of nature and deface

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: The patterns that by God and by French fathers

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Had twenty years been made. This is a stem

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Of that victorious stock; and let us fear

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: The native mightiness and fate of him.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Ambassadors from Harry King of England

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Do crave admittance to your majesty.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: We'll give them present audience. Go, and bring them.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Exeunt Messenger and certain Lords

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: You see this chase is hotly follow'd, friends.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Turn head, and stop pursuit; for coward dogs

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Most spend their mouths when what they seem to threaten

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Runs far before them. Good my sovereign,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Take up the English short, and let them know

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Of what a monarchy you are the head:

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Self-love, my liege, is not so vile a sin

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: As self-neglecting.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Re-enter Lords, with EXETER and train

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: From our brother England?

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: From him; and thus he greets your majesty.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: He wills you, in the name of God Almighty,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: That you divest yourself, and lay apart

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: The borrow'd glories that by gift of heaven,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: By law of nature and of nations, 'long

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: To him and to his heirs; namely, the crown

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And all wide-stretched honours that pertain

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: By custom and the ordinance of times

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Unto the crown of France. That you may know

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: 'Tis no sinister nor no awkward claim,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Pick'd from the worm-holes of long-vanish'd days,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Nor from the dust of old oblivion raked,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: He sends you this most memorable line,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: In every branch truly demonstrative;

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Willing to overlook this pedigree:

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And when you find him evenly derived

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: From his most famed of famous ancestors,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Edward the Third, he bids you then resign

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Your crown and kingdom, indirectly held

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: From him the native and true challenger.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Or else what follows?

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Bloody constraint; for if you hide the crown

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Even in your hearts, there will he rake for it:

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Therefore in fierce tempest is he coming,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: In thunder and in earthquake, like a Jove,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: That, if requiring fail, he will compel;

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And bids you, in the bowels of the Lord,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Deliver up the crown, and to take mercy

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: On the poor souls for whom this hungry war

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Opens his vasty jaws; and on your head

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Turning the widows' tears, the orphans' cries

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: The dead men's blood, the pining maidens groans,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: For husbands, fathers and betrothed lovers,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: That shall be swallow'd in this controversy.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: This is his claim, his threatening and my message;

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Unless the Dauphin be in presence here,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: To whom expressly I bring greeting too.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: For us, we will consider of this further:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: To-morrow shall you bear our full intent

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Back to our brother England.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: For the Dauphin,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: I stand here for him: what to him from England?

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Scorn and defiance; slight regard, contempt,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And any thing that may not misbecome

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: The mighty sender, doth he prize you at.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Thus says my king; an' if your father's highness

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Do not, in grant of all demands at large,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Sweeten the bitter mock you sent his majesty,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: He'll call you to so hot an answer of it,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: That caves and womby vaultages of France

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Shall chide your trespass and return your mock

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: In second accent of his ordnance.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Say, if my father render fair return,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: It is against my will; for I desire

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Nothing but odds with England: to that end,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: As matching to his youth and vanity,

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: I did present him with the Paris balls.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: He'll make your Paris Louvre shake for it,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Were it the mistress-court of mighty Europe:

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And, be assured, you'll find a difference,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: As we his subjects have in wonder found,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Between the promise of his greener days

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And these he masters now: now he weighs time

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Even to the utmost grain: that you shall read

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: In your own losses, if he stay in France.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: To-morrow shall you know our mind at full.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Dispatch us with all speed, lest that our king

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Come here himself to question our delay;

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: For he is footed in this land already.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: You shall be soon dispatch's with fair conditions:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: A night is but small breath and little pause

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: To answer matters of this consequence.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt
